wcag20.tech.aria.RegionLabel: Elements containing a 'region' role must be labeled with an aria-label or aria-labelledby.
wcag20.tech.aria.OrphanedContent: All content must reside within a WAI-ARIA landmark or labelled region role.
wcag20.tech.aria.EmptyPropertyValue: A WAI-ARIA property has an empty value.  A value must be specified.
wcag20.tech.aria1.ValidRole: Elements that use 'role' must reference a valid WAI-ARIA role.
wcag20.tech.aria.ValidRoleProperty: An element having a role must reference valid global or widget WAI-ARIA properties.
wcag20.tech.aria.ValidProperty: An element having a role must reference valid global or widget WAI-ARIA properties.
wcag20.tech.aria.ValidPropertyValue: Elements that use WAI-ARIA properties must reference valid values for the properties.
wcag20.tech.aria.ValidIdRef: Elements that use WAI-ARIA properties must reference valid IDs.
wcag20.tech.aria.ValidGlobalProperty: An element that does not have a role must reference only valid WAI-ARIA global properties.
wcag20.tech.aria.RequiredProperties: Elements that use 'role' must also use the WAI-ARIA required properties for the role.
wcag20.tech.aria.RequiredChildren: Elements that use 'role' must contain required child elements for the role.
wcag20.tech.aria.RequiredParent: Elements that use 'role' must be contained in required parent elements for the role.
wcag20.tech.aria.InvalidTabindexForActiv: Elements having an aria-activedescendant property must also contain a tabindex attribute with a value greater than or equal to zero.
wcag20.tech.aria.EventHandlerMissingRole: A non-form or non-anchor element having an event handler must have a valid WAI-ARIA role.
wcag20.tech.aria.MissingFocusableChild: WAI-ARIA widget elements must be focusable by default or a tabindex attribute in order to be keyboard operable.
wcag20.tech.aria.MissingKeyboardHandler: WAI-ARIA widget elements must have a onkeydown or onkeypress event handler in order to be keyboard operable.
wcag20.g10.inputExplicitLabelImage: Provide alternative text for all image-type buttons.
wcag20.g1064.scriptFocusBlurs: Do not use scripting to remove focus when focus is received.
wcag20.g1065.colorContrast1: Color contrast ratio is less than 3:1.
wcag20.g1066.colorContrast2: When color contrast ratio is less than 4.5:1, ensure that text is large scale.
wcag20.g1069.styleBeforeAfter: Do not use ::before and ::after pseudo-elements to insert non-decorative content.
wcag20.g1070.textLetterSpacing: Use CSS 'letter-spacing' to control spacing within a word.
wcag20.g1071.scriptUseW3CDomFunctions: Use functions of the DOM to add content to a page.
wcag20.tech.h2.imgLinkTextNotRedundant: Image alt text must not be redundant with adjacent link text.
wcag20.tech.h24.areaHasAlt: Area elements must have non-empty alt text.
wcag20.tech.h25.docHasTitle: There must be a non-empty title element in the head of the document.
wcag20.tech.h30-h91.aHasText: Hyperlinks must contain link text or an image with alt text.
wcag20.tech.h32.formHasSubmit: Forms must contain a submit button or an image button.
wcag20.tech.h33.aTitleUsage: Check that the title attribute together with the link text describes the purpose of the link.
wcag20.tech.h35.appletHasAlt: Applet elements must have alt text in the alt attribute and in the element body.
wcag20.tech.h36.inputImageHasAlt2: Check that the alt attribute indicates the button's function.
wcag20.tech.h37.imgHasAlt: Images must have an alt attribute, and must be the empty string if decorative.
wcag20.tech.h39-h73.tableCapSummRedundan: The summary must not duplicate the caption.
wcag20.tech.h36-h44-h65-h91.inputExplici: Each form control must have associated label.
wcag20.tech.h44.inputLabelBefore: Text inputs and select elements must have a label before the input control.
wcag20.tech.h44.inputLabelAfter: Check boxes and radio buttons must have a label after the input control.
wcag20.tech.h46.embedHasNoEmbed: Embed elements should be immediately followed by a noembed element.
wcag20.tech.h27-h53.objectHasAlt: Objects must contain inner text as alt text.
wcag20.tech.h57.htmlLangValid: Html element must have lang and/or xml:lang attribute that conforms to BCP: 47.
wcag20.tech.h58.elemLangValid: Lang and/or xml:lang attribute on any element on the page to identify change in language must conform to BCP: 47.
wcag20.tech.h59.linkValid: Navigation link elements must be contained in the head, and must have rel and href attributes.
wcag20.tech.h63.tableScopeValid: Valid values for scope attribute are row, col, rowgroup, or colgroup.
wcag20.tech.h64.frameHasTitle: Frames and IFrames must have a non-empty title attribute.
wcag20.tech.h67.imgTitleEmptyWhenAltNull: When alt text is empty, the title must also be empty.
wcag20.tech.h71.inputInFieldSet: Check that groups of logically related input elements are contained within a fieldset element.
wcag20.tech.h71.inputRadioChkInFieldSet: Groups of radio buttons or check boxes with the same name attribute must be contained within a fieldset element. A WAI-ARIA group or radiogroup can meet this requirement (see online help).
wcag20.tech.h71.fieldsetHasLegend: Fieldsets must have a single, non-empty legend.
wcag20.tech.h73.tableSummaryAria2: Complex data tables must have a summary or an aria-describedby which references a summary.
wcag20.tech.h76-f41.metaRedirectZero: Do not cause a page to redirect to a new URL after a delay.
wcag20.tech.h84.selectNoChangeAction: Check that focus (including keyboard focus) on an option in the select element does not result in any actions being performed.
wcag20.tech.h85.selectHasOptGroup: If there are groups of related options, they should be grouped with optgroup.
wcag20.tech.aria1.ariaDescribedByValid: Elements that use 'aria-describedby' must reference a valid node ID.
wcag20.tech.other.ariaLabelledByValid: Elements that use 'aria-labelledby' must reference a valid node ID.
wcag20.tech.g1.bodyFirstASkips: The page must provide a link to skip directly to the main page content as the first link on each page or use WAI-ARIA landmarks.
wcag20.tech.g1.bodyFirstAContainsSkipTex: Check that the description of the first hyperlink communicates that it links to the main content.
wcag20.tech.h44.labelTargetInvisible: Do not label hidden input elements (type=hidden).
wcag20.tech.g11.blinkAlwaysTrigger: Do not use the blink element.
wcag20.tech.g13.inputHasOnchange: If changing an input's value changes the context, check that an explanation of the change is provided in advance to the user.
rpt.g1.styleTrigger: Web pages must be readable without requiring style sheets or equivalent facilitation is provided.
rpt.g3.listMisuse: List elements missing, or improperly structured.  Do not use list elements for formatting.
rpt.g5.marqueeTrigger: Avoid scrolling text created with the MARQUEE element.
rpt.g7.headersFewWords: Make sure header elements are not used only for bold text.
rpt.g11.usemapValid: Provide text links that duplicate all server-side image map hot-spots.
rpt.g24.mediaAudioTrigger: Provide transcripts for all audio files.
rpt.g25.blockquoteHasCite: Make sure BLOCKQUOTE is used only for quotations, not indentation.
rpt.g32.styleTriggerG32: Use style sheets to control layout and presentation wherever possible.
rpt.g33.metaRefresh: Do not cause a page to refresh automatically.
rpt.g99.mediaAltBrief: Alt text >150 characters, consider providing a separate description.
rpt.g112.aTargetAndText: Inform the user that clicking on certain links or areas of a window will open pop-up windows or change the active window.
rpt.g115.mediaTrigger115: Provide accessible alternatives to the information in scripts, applets, or objects.
rpt.g207.triggerOnce: Provide a clear, consistent navigation structure.
rpt.g218.triggerOnce: Use a consistent style of presentation between pages.
rpt.g245.mediaImgColorUsage: If you use color to convey information, make sure the information is also represented another way.
rpt.g256.elemDeprecated: Avoid use of obsolete language features if possible.
rpt.g257.triggerOnce: Allow users to customize their experience of the Web page.
rpt.g263.blockquoteWrapsTextQuote: Mark up any quotations with the Q and BLOCKQUOTE elements.
rpt.g269.elemEventMouseAndKey: Ensure that mouse event handlers have a corresponding keyboard handler.
rpt.g271.documentHasDoctype: Use a public text identifier in a DOCTYPE statement.
rpt.g330.scriptTrigger: If scripts, applets, or objects update content dynamically, ensure alternative content is also updated.
rpt.g394.fontColorInForm: Color must not be used as the only way to indicate required form fields.
rpt.g398.labelUniqueFor: Do not provide multiple LABELs for one form control.
rpt.g453.imgAltCommonMisuse: Ensure that image alt text serves as an inline replacement of the image.
rpt.g1090.presentationImgHasNonNullAlt: Do not apply a non-null alt attribute to an image with role=presentation.
rpt.g1091.multipleMainsVisibleLabel: Prefer aria-labelledby over aria-label on a 'main' landmark if a visible label, such as a  heading, is present.
rpt.g1092.multipleBannerLandmarks: Multiple WAI-ARIA 'banner' landmarks must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1093.multipleComplementaryLandmarks: Multiple WAI-ARIA 'complementary' landmarks must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1094.multipleContentinfoLandmarks: Multiple WAI-ARIA 'contentinfo' landmarks must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1095.multipleFormLandmarks: Multiple WAI-ARIA 'form' landmarks must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1096.multipleNavigationLandmarks: Multiple WAI-ARIA 'navigation' landmarks must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1097.multipleSearchLandmarks: Multiple WAI-ARIA 'search' landmarks must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1098.complementaryLandmarkLabel: Prefer aria-labelledby over aria-label on a 'complementary' landmark if a visible label, such as a  heading, is present.
rpt.g1099.multipleApplicationLandmarks: Multiple WAI-ARIA 'application' landmarks must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1100.applicationLandmarkLabel: A WAI-ARIA 'application' landmark must have a label specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1101.multipleDocumentRoles: Multiple elements having a WAI-ARIA 'document' role must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1102.documentRoleLabel: Elements having a WAI-ARIA 'document' role must have a label specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1103.multipleArticleRoles: Multiple elements having a WAI-ARIA 'article' role must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1104.articleRoleLabel: Elements having a WAI-ARIA 'article' role must have a label specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1105.multipleGroupRoles: Multiple elements having a WAI-ARIA 'group' role must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1106.groupRoleLabel: Elements having a WAI-ARIA 'group' role must have a label specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby except when there is parent element containing a menu, menubar, or tree role.
rpt.g1107.multipleContentinfoInSiblingSe: Only one 'contentinfo' node in a set of siblings is permitted.
rpt.g1108.oneMainInSiblingSet: More than one 'main' landmark in a set of sibling elements is not permitted.
rpt.g1109.oneBannerInSiblingSet: More than one 'banner' landmark in a set of sibling elements is not permitted.
rpt.g1110.widgetLabels: A WAI-ARIA widget must have an accessible name (see message help text for details).
rpt.g1111.contentinfoWithNoMain: A 'contentinfo' role is not permitted without the presence of a 'main' role.
rpt.g1113.complementaryRequiredLabel: Elements having a WAI-ARIA 'complementary' role must have a label specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1114.multipleMainsRequireLabel: Multiple elements having a WAI-ARIA 'main' role must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1115.multipleRegionsUniqueLabel: Multiple elements having a WAI-ARIA 'region' role must have unique labels specified with aria-label or aria-labelledby.
haac.g1116.iOSFlashTrigger: Mobile Safari does not support Java applets, Flash or other third party plug-ins. Use accessible alternative for media content.
haac.g1117.VideoHasNoTrack: HTML5 Video element must contain a track element with kind="captions" in the language of the video.
haac.g1118.hasSliderTrigger: WAI ARIA slider widget is not accessibile as of now.
haac.g1119.hasAudioVideoTrigger: HTML5 audio and video elements must have keyboard accessible controls.
haac.g1120.hasMobileSimpleDialogTrigger: When a dialog is dismissed, ensure that the focus is returned to the element that invoked the dialog.
haac.g1121.hasMobileiOSstyleDatePickerTr: The Dojo mobile iOS style DatePicker widget is not accessible.Use the Android style ValuePickerDatePicker widget.
haac.g1122.hasMobileiOSstyleTimePickerTr: The Dojo mobile iOS style TimePicker widget is not accessible.Use the Android style ValuePickerTimePicker widget.
haac.g1123.hasMobileScrollableViewTrigge: Do not use the Dojo mobile ScrollableView as it is not accessible at this time.
haac.g1124.InputHasRequired: If your application must be accessible in Internet Explorer 8, use aria-required instead of the HTML5 required property.
haac.g1125.MobileRatingNoImgRoleTrigger: The Dojo mobile Rating widget must have an image role with a nonempty alternate text.
haac.g1126.MobileProgressIndicatorNoImgR: The Dojo mobile ProgressIndicator widget must have an image role with a nonempty alternate text.
haac.g1127.MobileDOMButtonNoRoleTrigger: The Dojo mobile DOM button widget must have an image role with alternate text or a button role with label.
haac.g1128.MobileAriaImgAlt: The WAI-ARIA widget with img role must have a nonempty alternate text or a label.
haac.g1129.MobileSimpleDialogWithNoRoleT: The Dojo mobile Simple Dialog must have a dialog role with accessible name to be CI 162 complaint.
haac.g1130.MobileTabBarButtonWithNoMoveT: Use the moveTo property of the TabBarButton widget to establish an aria-controls relationship between a selected tab and its tabpanel.
haac.g1131.MobileSearchBoxNorelationTrig: The Dojo Mobile SearchBox widget must use its aria-controls property with a valid id to establish a relationship between the search box and its results to be accessible.
haac.g1132.BackgroundImgHasTextOrTitle: Verify that important background image information is conveyed when the system is in high contrast mode.
haac.g1133.MainHasNoRole: Html5 element <main> used in the content to identify a page Landmark/Section does not have the corresponding WAI-ARIA "main" role defined.
haac.g1134.NavHasNoRole: Html5 element <nav> used in the content to identify a page Landmark/Section does not have the corresponding WAI-ARIA "navigation" role defined.
haac.g1135.AsideHasNoRole: Html5 element <aside> used in the content to identify a page Landmark/Section does not have the corresponding WAI-ARIA "complementary" role defined.
haac.g1136.ArticleHasNoRole: Html5 element <article> used in the content to identify a page Landmark/Section does not have the corresponding WAI-ARIA "article" role defined.
haac.g1137.FooterHasNoRole: Html5 element <footer> used in the content to identify a page Landmark/Section does not have the corresponding WAI-ARIA "contentinfo" role defined.
haac.g1138.HeaderHasNoRole: Html5 element <header> used in the content to identify a page Landmark/Section does not have the corresponding WAI-ARIA "banner" role defined.
haac.g1139.SectionHasNoRole: Html5 element <section> used in the content to identify a page Landmark/Section does not have the corresponding WAI-ARIA "region" role defined.
haac.g1140.AccesskeyNeedLabel: The accesskey assigned on the HTML element must have an associated label.
haac.g1141.AriaOrHTML5Attribute: Do not use the HTML5 attribute and the associated WAI-ARIA attribute such that it creates a conflict on any one input element.
haac.g1142.AriaSemantics: The WAI ARIA role does not meet implicit ARIA semantic restriction(s) for the element.
haac.g1143.Canvas: Check accessibility of the Canvas element.
haac.g1144.FigureLabel: The figure element must have an associated label.
haac.g1145.InputPlaceholder: Do not use the HTML 5 placeholder as a label replacement.
rpt.g454.imgLongDescription2: Longdesc URL extension not recognized as a reference to HTML content.
rpt.g456.styleBackgroundImage: Do not use CSS alone to provide important information in images.
rpt.1073.styleBackgroundImage: Check external style sheets to ensure that CSS alone does not provide important information in images.
rpt.g457.triggerOnce: Provide text alternative when using text look-alikes to represent text.
rpt.g458.preAsciiArt: Provide a text alternative for ASCII art.
rpt.g459.mediaVideoTrigger: For videos without audio, check that an alternative is provided.
rpt.g460.mediaAudioVideoAltFilename: Do not use filenames or placeholder text as a descriptive label for audio or video media.
rpt.g462.mediaAudioVideoAltFilename: For pre-recorded media, provide captions for audio content.
rpt.g464.mediaAudioVideoAltFilename: For pre-recorded media, check for a media alternative, or that a user-selectable audio track includes an audio description.
rpt.g466.styleColorSemantics1: Combine color and descriptive markup to convey information.
rpt.g1004.styleColorSemantics2: Check external style sheets to ensure that color and descriptive markup are combined to convey information.
rpt.g468.listNotText: Use proper HTML tags to create lists.
rpt.g469.styleTriggerG469: Information conveyed through variations in visual presentation must also be conveyed through text.
rpt.g470.scriptOnclickHTML1: Do not use scripts to emulate links.
rpt.g471.tableStructure: Do not use structural element(s) and/or attribute(s) in a table that is only used for layout purposes.
rpt.g472.triggerOnce: Use sufficient contrast ratios for displaying Web content.
rpt.g473.imgAltTriggerNonDecorative: Use text to convey information rather than images of text.
rpt.g475.triggerOnce: Provide enough time for users to read and use Web content.
rpt.g476.mediaTrigger: Provide a mechanism to pause and restart time limits set by content.
rpt.g479.blinkCSSTrigger1: Do not use the BLINK value of the text-decoration property for longer than five seconds.
rpt.g1001.blinkCSSTrigger1: Check external style sheets for usage of the BLINK value of the 'text-decoration' property for longer than five seconds.
rpt.g480.mediaTriggerG480: Make sure content does not flash more than three times per second or that it falls below the flash threshold.
rpt.g481.htmlSkipNav: Provide a mechanism to bypass blocks of content that are repeated on multiple Web pages.
rpt.g484.titleValid: Provide descriptive titles for Web pages.
rpt.g488.headerHasContent: Provide descriptive headings for Web page sections.
rpt.g1002.headerHasContent: Check headings to ensure that they describe Web page sections.
rpt.g491.formTargetAndText: Inform the user that interacting with content will open pop-up windows or change the active window.
rpt.g492.formChangeSubmit1: Do not automatically submit a form without warning the user.
rpt.g493.formTrigger: Provide text that identifies incomplete required form fields.
rpt.g494.triggerOnce: Ensure that user agents can accurately interpret and parse content.
rpt.g501.mediaVideoObjectTrigger: For live media, provide captions for audio content.
rpt.g502.textSensoryReference: Ensure instructions for using page content do not solely rely on sensory characteristics.
rpt.g503.embedAutoStart: Provide mechanisms to pause or stop audio play and to control the volume.
rpt.g505.scriptTriggerG505: Ensure that keyboard focus does not get trapped in content.
rpt.g506.styleHinderFocus1: Ensure that, with the border or outline, the keyboard focus indicator is visible to users.
rpt.g1015.styleHinderFocus1: Check external style sheets to ensure that the keyboard focus indicator is visible to users.
rpt.g508.inputTriggerG508: Input errors must be easily identified so that users can determine what is wrong.
rpt.g509.inputButtonSubmitTrigger: Allow users to reverse actions that might result in legal or financial obligations.
rpt.g511.mediaVideoTrigger: For pre-recorded media, check that a user-selectable audio track includes an audio description.
rpt.g512.htmlNavigation512: Provide multiple ways to locate a particular Web page within a set of Web pages.
rpt.g1051.embedHasAlt: Provide alternative content for EMBED elements.
rpt.g1060.tableLayoutTrigger: Avoid using tables to format text documents in columns unless the table can be linearized.
rpt.g1061.tableDataHeadingsAria: For a data table (i.e., the table tag does not contain a WAI-ARIA 'presentation' role), identify headers for the table rows and columns.
rpt.g1062.labelRefValid: Label 'For' attribute does not reference an appropriate form control.
rpt.g1063.elemUniqueAccessKey: Accesskey values must be unique on the page.
haac.g1067.imgUsemapAlt: Images with an image map must also have alternative text.
haac.g1072.mediaDocumentTrigger: Check the accessibility of linked documents.
val.g1052.noembedHasContent: Provide descriptive text in noembed elements.
val.g1053.captionHasContent: Provide descriptive text in the table's caption.
val.g1054.captionInTable: Caption elements must be used inside of a table element.
val.g1055.labelHasContent: Provide descriptive text in label elements.
val.g1056.elemDirValid: Valid values for the dir attribute are 'ltr', 'rtl' or 'auto'.
val.g1057.frameSrcHtml: Frames that contain content that is not HTML may not be accessible.
val.g1058.elemAccNameBrief: When the Accessible Name is > 150 characters, consider providing a separate description.
val.g1059.tableDataCellRelationships: For a complex data table, th and td elements must be related via scope or headers.
rpt.g1101.multipleDocumentRoles: Multiple elements {0} with the WAI-ARIA role {1} do not have the required unique label specified by aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1102.documentRoleLabel: The {0} element with a WAI-ARIA role {1} does not have the required label specified by aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1103.multipleArticleRoles: Multiple elements {0} with the WAI-ARIA role {1} do not have the required unique label specified by aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1104.articleRoleLabel: The {0} element with a WAI-ARIA role {1} does not have the required label specified by aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1105.multipleGroupRoles: Multiple elements {0} with the WAI-ARIA role {1} do not have the required unique label specified by aria-label or aria-labelledby.
rpt.g1106.groupRoleLabel: The {0} element with a WAI-ARIA role {1} does not have the required label specified by aria-label or aria-labelledby.
wcag20.tech.aria.EventHandlerMissingRole: The {0} element with {1} does not have a valid WAI-ARIA role specified. See rule help for remediation guidance.
wcag20.tech.aria.MissingFocusableChild: The descendent {0} element with WAI-ARIA role {1} does not have tabindex attribute set to 0 or -1 to be accessible by keyboard. See rule help for remediation guidance.
wcag20.tech.aria.MissingKeyboardHandler: The {0} element with WAI-ARIA role {1} might not be keyboard accessible. See rule help for remediation guidance.
wcag20.tech.aria.ValidPropertyValue: The value {0} specified for WAI-ARIA property {1} on element {2} is not valid. See rule help for remediation guidance.
wcag20.tech.aria.ValidIdRef: The id {0} specified for WAI-ARIA property {1} on element {2} is not valid. See rule help for remediation guidance.
wcag20.tech.aria.InvalidTabindexForActiv: The {0} element with WAI-ARIA property aria-activedescendant set to {1} does not have tabindex attribute set to 0 or -1. See rule help for remediation guidance.
wcag20.tech.aria.RequiredProperties: An element with WAI-ARIA role {0} is missing the following required WAI-ARIA properties: {1}. See rule help for remediation guidance.
wcag20.tech.aria.RequiredChildren: An element with WAI-ARIA role {0} does not contain or own at least one child element with each of the following WAI-ARIA roles: {1}. See rule help for remediation guidance.
wcag20.tech.aria.RequiredParent: An element with WAI-ARIA role {0} is not contained in or owned by an element with one of the following WAI-ARIA roles: {1}. See rule help for remediation guidance.
wcag20.tech.aria.EmptyPropertyValue: The WAI-ARIA property {0} used by the element is missing the required value for the property. See rule help for remediation guidance.
wcag20.tech.aria.ValidProperty: The attribute {0} referenced by the element {1} is not a valid WAI-ARIA State or Property.
wcag20.tech.aria.ValidRoleProperty: The WAI-ARIA property {0} is not supported on elements with WAI-ARIA role {1}.
wcag20.tech.aria.ValidGlobalProperty: The WAI-ARIA property {0} is not supported global property on element {1} that does not have a WAI-ARIA role.
rpt.g263.blockquoteWrapsTextQuote: If the following text is a quotation, mark it as a Q or BLOCKQUOTE element: {0}.
rpt.g502.textSensoryReference: If this instance of the word(s) {0} is part of instructions for using page content, ensure the instructions can be understood by a user who may not have sensory perception of size, sound, shape, or location.
rpt.g471.tableStructure: The {0} element with WAI-ARIA presentation role has structural element(s) and/or attribute(s) {1}.
rpt.g1062.labelRefValid: The id "{0}" referenced by the 'for' attribute of a label element is not a valid form input element or an element with id "{0}" is either null or does not exist.
haac.g1142.AriaSemantics: The WAI-ARIA role(s) {0} do not meet the default implicit ARIA semantic(s) and restriction(s) for the element {1}. If specified allowed roles must be {2}.
rpt.g269.elemEventMouseAndKey: The {0} element with mouse event handler(s) {1} does not have corresponding keyboard handler(s).
rpt.g377.elemUniqueId: The {0} element has the id "{1}" that is either empty or already in use.
CI162_5_2_DCP070111.name: IBM Accessibility July 2011
CI162_5_2_DCP080312.name: IBM Accessibility August 2012
CI162_5_2_DCP020313.name: IBM Accessibility February 2013
CI162_5_2_Mobile_DCP070113.name: IBM Accessibility Mobile July 2013
CI162_5_2_DCP080113.name: IBM Accessibility August 2013
CI162_5_2_DCP080114.name: IBM Accessibility August 2014
CI162_5_2_DCP020115.name: IBM Accessibility February 2015
CI162_5_2_DCP080115.name: IBM Accessibility August 2015
CI162_5_2_DCP070116.name: IBM Accessibility July 2016
CI162_5_2_508.name: IBM Accessibility US Sec 508
CI162.description.1_1_a: Text Alternatives: All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose.
CI162.description.1_1_b: WCAG 2.0 Non-text Content: A descriptive label is provided for time-based media, including live audio-only and live video-only content.
CI162.description.1_1_c: Image Maps: Client-side image maps are used and alternative text is provided for image map hot spots. Equivalent text links are provided if a server-side image map is used.
CI162.description.1_2_a: Captions: Captions are provided for prerecorded audio content in synchronized media, except when the media is a media alternative for text and is clearly labeled as such.
CI162.description.1_2_b: Audio and Video (Prerecorded): Audio and Video (Prerecorded): An alternative for time-based media or audio description of the prerecorded video content is provided for synchronized media, except when the media is a media alternative for text and is clearly labeled as such.
CI162.description.1_2_c: Live Multimedia: Captions are provided for live multimedia.
CI162.description.AA1_2_4: Captions (Live): Captions are provided for all live audio content in synchronized media
CI162.description.AA1_2_5: Audio Description: Audio description is provided for all prerecorded video content in synchronized media.
CI162.description.1_3_a: Information and Relationships: Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text.
CI162.description.1_3_c: Meaningful Sequence: When the sequence in which content is presented affects its meaning, a correct reading sequence can be programmatically determined.
CI162.description.1_3_d: Forms: Form element labels can be programmatically determined.
CI162.description.1_3_e: Tables: Table cells and relationships between cells can be programmatically determined.
CI162.description.1_3_f: Cascading Style Sheets: Web pages are readable without requiring style sheets.
CI162.description.1_3_g: Sensory Characteristics: Instructions provided for understanding and operating content do not rely solely on sensory characteristics of components such as shape, size, visual location, orientation, or sound.
CI162.description.1_4_a: Use of Color: Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information, indicating an action, prompting a response, or distinguishing a visual element.
CI162.description.1_4_b: Audio Control: If any audio on a Web page plays automatically for more than 3 seconds, either a mechanism is available to pause or stop the audio, or a mechanism is available to control audio volume independently from the overall system volume level.
CI162.description.AA1_4_3: Contrast (Minimum): The visual presentation of text and images of text has a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, except for large print and images of large print, which must have a contrast ratio of 3:1. Decorative images and logotypes are exempt from this requirement.
CI162.description.AA1_4_4: Resize Text: Text (but not images of text) can be resized without assistive technology up to 200 percent without loss of content or functionality.
CI162.description.AA1_4_5: Images of Text: Use text to convey information rather than images. An image of text may be used when it is essential to the information being conveyed and the image can be visually customized to the user's requirements.
CI162.description.2_1_a: Keyboard: All functionality of the content is operable through a keyboard interface without requiring specific timings for individual keystrokes, except where the underlying function requires input that depends on the path of the user's movement and not just the endpoints.
CI162.description.2_1_b: Scripts: Scripts are keyboard accessible. If the content affected by scripting is not accessible, an alternative is provided.
CI162.description.2_1_c: Applets, Plug-ins, and Non-HTML content: A link is provided to a directly accessible applet, plug-in or other application. Alternate content is provided for those applets, plug-ins or other applications that are not directly accessible.
CI162.description.2_1_d: No Keyboard Trap: If keyboard focus can be moved to a component of the page using a keyboard interface, then focus can be moved away from that component using only a keyboard interface, and, if it requires more than unmodified arrow or tab keys, the user is advised of the method for moving focus away.
CI162.description.2_2_a: Adjust Time Responses: The user is allowed to turn off, adjust or extend all time limits that are not a real-time, essential or 20 hour exception.
CI162.description.2_2_b: Pause, Stop, Hide: The user is allowed to pause, stop, or hide moving, blinking, scrolling, or auto-updating information unless it is an essential part of an activity.
CI162.description.2_3_a: Flashing Content or Below Threshold: Web pages do not contain anything that flashes more than two times in any one second period, or the flash is below the general flash and red flash thresholds.
CI162.description.2_4_a: Navigational Features: A mechanism is available to bypass blocks of content that are repeated on multiple Web pages.
CI162.description.2_4_b: Navigate to main content: Methods are provided for skipping over navigation links to get to the main content of the page.
CI162.description.2_4_c: Frames: A title and an accessible frame source are provided for each frame.
CI162.description.2_4_d: Page Titles: Web pages have titles that describe topic or purpose.
CI162.description.2_4_e: Focus Order: If a Web page can be navigated sequentially and the navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability.
CI162.description.2_4_f: Link Purpose: The purpose of each link can be determined from the link text alone or from the link text together with its programmatically determined link context, except where the purpose of the link would be ambiguous to users in general.
CI162.description.AA2_4_5: Multiple Ways: More than one way is available to locate a Web page within a set of Web pages except where the Web Page is the result of, or a step in, a process.
CI162.description.AA2_4_6: Headings and Labels: Headings and labels describe topic or purpose.
CI162.description.AA2_4_7: Focus Visible: Any keyboard operable user interface has a mode of operation where the keyboard focus indicator is visible.
CI162.description.3_1_a: Language of Page: The default human language of each Web page can be programmatically determined.
CI162.description.AA3_1_2: Language of Parts: The human language of each passage or phrase in the content can be programmatically determined except for proper names, technical terms, words of indeterminate language, and words or phrases that have become part of the vernacular of the immediately surrounding text.
CI162.description.3_2_a: On Focus: When any component receives focus, it does not initiate a change of context.
CI162.description.3_2_b: On Input: Changing the setting of any user interface component does not automatically cause a change of context unless the user has been advised of the behavior before using the component.
CI162.description.AA3_2_3: Consistent Navigation: Navigational mechanisms that are repeated on multiple Web pages within a set of Web pages occur in the same relative order each time they are repeated, unless a change is initiated by the user.
CI162.description.AA3_2_4: Consistent Identification: Components that have the same functionality within a set of Web pages are identified consistently.
CI162.description.3_3_a: Error Identification: If an input error is automatically detected, the item that is in error is identified and the error is described to the user in text.
CI162.description.3_3_b: Labels or Instructions: Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input.
CI162.description.AA3_3_3: Error Suggestion: If an input error is automatically detected and suggestions for correction are known, then the suggestions are provided to the user, unless it would jeopardize the security or purpose of the content.
CI162.description.AA3_3_4: Error Prevention (Legal, Financial, Data): Web pages used for legal commitments or financial transactions that modify user-controlled data in a storage system or submit test responses must be checked for input errors and provide the user with the ability to correct information before submission or reverse the submission.
CI162.description.4_1_a: Parsing: In content implemented using markup languages, elements have complete start and end tags, elements are nested according to their specifications, elements do not contain duplicate attributes, and any IDs are unique, except where the specifications allow these features.
CI162.description.4_1_b: Name, Role, Value: For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies.
CI162.description.4_2_a: Text-only Page: If accessibility cannot be accomplished in any other way, a text-only page with equivalent information or functionality is provided.
CI162.description.4_2_b: Accessibility-Supported Technologies Only: Use accessibility supported technologies. Any information or functionality that is implemented in technologies that are not accessibility supported must also be available via technologies that are accessibility supported
WCAG20.name: WCAG 2.0
WCAG20.description.1_1_1: Non-text Content: All non-text content that is presented to the user has a text alternative that serves the equivalent purpose, except for the situations listed below
WCAG20.description.1_2_1: Audio-only and Video-only (Prerecorded): For prerecorded audio-only and prerecorded video-only media, the following are true, except when the audio or video is a media alternative for text and is clearly labeled as such
WCAG20.description.1_2_2: Captions (Prerecorded): Captions are provided for all prerecorded audio content in synchronized media, except when the media is a media alternative for text and is clearly labeled as such
WCAG20.description.1_2_3: Audio Description or Media Alternative (Prerecorded): An alternative for time-based media or audio description of the prerecorded video content is provided for synchronized media, except when the media is a media alternative for text and is clearly labeled as such
WCAG20.description.1_2_4: Captions (Live): Captions are provided for all live audio content in synchronized media
WCAG20.description.1_2_5: Audio Description (Prerecorded): Audio description is provided for all prerecorded video content in synchronized media
WCAG20.description.1_3_1: Info and Relationships: Information, structure, and relationships conveyed through presentation can be programmatically determined or are available in text
WCAG20.description.1_3_2: Meaningful Sequence: When the sequence in which content is presented affects its meaning, a correct reading sequence can be programmatically determined
WCAG20.description.1_3_3: Sensory Characteristics: Instructions provided for understanding and operating content do not rely solely on sensory characteristics of components such as shape, size, visual location, orientation, or sound
WCAG20.description.1_4_1: Use of Color: Color is not used as the only visual means of conveying information, indicating an action, prompting a response, or distinguishing a visual element
WCAG20.description.1_4_2: Audio Control: If any audio on a Web page plays automatically for more than 3 seconds, either a mechanism is available to pause or stop the audio, or a mechanism is available to control audio volume independently from the overall system volume level
WCAG20.description.1_4_3: Contrast (Minimum): The visual presentation of text and images of text has a contrast ratio of at least 4.5:1, except for the following:
WCAG20.description.1_4_4: Resize text: Except for captions and images of text, text can be resized without assistive technology up to 200 percent without loss of content or functionality
WCAG20.description.1_4_5: Images of Text: If the technologies being used can achieve the visual presentation, text is used to convey information rather than images of text except for the following:
WCAG20.description.2_1_1: Keyboard: All functionality of the content is operable through a keyboard interface without requiring specific timings for individual keystrokes, except where the underlying function requires input that depends on the path of the user's movement and not just the endpoints
WCAG20.description.2_1_2: No Keyboard Trap: If keyboard focus can be moved to a component of the page using a keyboard interface, then focus can be moved away from that component using only a keyboard interface, and, if it requires more than unmodified arrow or tab keys or other standard exit methods, the user is advised of the method for moving focus away
WCAG20.description.2_2_1: Timing Adjustable: For each time limit that is set by the content, at least one of the following is true:
WCAG20.description.2_2_2: Pause, Stop, Hide: For moving, blinking, scrolling, or auto-updating information, all of the following are true:
WCAG20.description.2_3_1: Three Flashes or Below Threshold: Web pages do not contain anything that flashes more than three times in any one second period, or the flash is below the general flash and red flash thresholds
WCAG20.description.2_4_1: Bypass Blocks: A mechanism is available to bypass blocks of content that are repeated on multiple Web pages
WCAG20.description.2_4_2: Page Titled: Web pages have titles that describe topic or purpose
WCAG20.description.2_4_3: Focus Order: If a Web page can be navigated sequentially and the navigation sequences affect meaning or operation, focusable components receive focus in an order that preserves meaning and operability
WCAG20.description.2_4_4: Link Purpose (In Context): The purpose of each link can be determined from the link text alone or from the link text together with its programmatically determined link context, except where the purpose of the link would be ambiguous to users in general
WCAG20.description.2_4_5: Multiple Ways: More than one way is available to locate a Web page within a set of Web pages except where the Web Page is the result of, or a step in, a process
WCAG20.description.2_4_6: Headings and Labels: Headings and labels describe topic or purpose
WCAG20.description.2_4_7: Focus Visible: Any keyboard operable user interface has a mode of operation where the keyboard focus indicator is visible
WCAG20.description.3_1_1: Language of Page: The default human language of each Web page can be programmatically determined
WCAG20.description.3_1_2: Language of Parts: The human language of each passage or phrase in the content can be programmatically determined except for proper names, technical terms, words of indeterminate language, and words or phrases that have become part of the vernacular of the immediately surrounding text
WCAG20.description.3_2_1: On Focus: When any component receives focus, it does not initiate a change of context
WCAG20.description.3_2_2: On Input: Changing the setting of any user interface component does not automatically cause a change of context unless the user has been advised of the behavior before using the component
WCAG20.description.3_2_3: Consistent Navigation: Navigational mechanisms that are repeated on multiple Web pages within a set of Web pages occur in the same relative order each time they are repeated, unless a change is initiated by the user
WCAG20.description.3_2_4: Consistent Identification: Components that have the same functionality within a set of Web pages are identified consistently
WCAG20.description.3_3_1: Error Identification: If an input error is automatically detected, the item that is in error is identified and the error is described to the user in text
WCAG20.description.3_3_2: Labels or Instructions: Labels or instructions are provided when content requires user input
WCAG20.description.3_3_3: Error Suggestion: If an input error is automatically detected and suggestions for correction are known, then the suggestions are provided to the user, unless it would jeopardize the security or purpose of the content
WCAG20.description.3_3_4: Error Prevention (Legal, Financial, Data): For Web pages that cause legal commitments or financial transactions for the user to occur, that modify or delete user-controllable data in data storage systems, or that submit user test responses, at least one of the following is true:
WCAG20.description.4_1_1: Parsing: In content implemented using markup languages, elements have complete start and end tags, elements are nested according to their specifications, elements do not contain duplicate attributes, and any IDs are unique, except where the specifications allow these features
WCAG20.description.4_1_2: Name, Role, Value: For all user interface components (including but not limited to: form elements, links and components generated by scripts), the name and role can be programmatically determined; states, properties, and values that can be set by the user can be programmatically set; and notification of changes to these items is available to user agents, including assistive technologies
haac.g1148.colorAA: Color contrast of {0} is not sufficient to meet WCAG AA requirements for text of size {1}px and weight of {2}
haac.g1149.colorAABackground: Color contrast of {0} is not sufficient to meet WCAG AA requirements for text of size {1}px and weight of {2}, but background images or gradients may be improving the contrast.
